availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: James A. Simpson (Nelson County, Kentucky, apprentice carpenter & private CSA & POW)

body.p: Nelson County, Kentucky, apprentice carpenter and soldier. Kentucky native. Son of Henry H. Simpson and Frances E. O'Bryan Simpson. Student in Nelson County in 1850. Apprentice carpenter in Nelson County in 1860. Served in the 8th Kentucky Cavalry Regiment (C.S.A.) as a private. Captured at Buffington, Ohio, on July 19, 1862. Prisoner of war in Camp Douglas from August 22, 1863, to February 24, 1865. Transferred to Point Lookout, Maryland, on February 24, 1865.

ab.bibl:

Selected Records of the War Department Relating to Confederate Prisoners of War, 1861-1865, NARA RG 109, Microfilm Series M598, Roll 145, vol. 426, OCGP 1-2, Register of Prisoners at Camp Douglas, Ill., and Camp Morton, Ind., 1862-1863, p. 36305 of 55967 of microfilm (accessed through Ancestry.com on December 14, 2020).
